1.text: Masters, give to your servants that which is just and equal; knowing that ye also have a Master in heaven.

2.text: Continue in prayer, and watch in the same with thanksgiving;

3.text: At the same time praying also for us, that God would open to us a door of utterance, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in bonds:

4.text: That I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.

5.text: Walk in wisdom towards them that are without, redeeming the time.

6.text: Let your speech be always with grace, seasoned with salt, that ye may know how ye ought to answer every man.

7.text: All my state shall Tychicus declare to you, who is a beloved brother, and a faithful minister and fellow-servant in the Lord:

8.text: Whom I have sent to you for the same purpose, that he may know your state, and comfort your hearts;

9.text: With Onesimus, a faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They will make known to you all things which are done here.

10.text: Aristarchus, my fellow-prisoner, saluteth you; and Marcus, sisterâ€™s son to Barnabas, (concerning whom ye received commandments: if he should come to you, receive him;)

11.text: And Jesus, who is called Justus, who are of the circumcision. These only are my fellow-workers to the kingdom of God, who have been a comfort to me.

12.text: Epaphras, who is one of you, a servant of Christ, saluteth you, always laboring fervently for you in prayers, that ye may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.

13.text: For I bear him testimony, that he hath a great zeal for you, and them that are in Laodicea, and them in Hierapolis.

14.text: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas, greet you.

15.text: Salute the brethren who are in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the church which is in his house.

16.text: And when this epistle is read among you, cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans; and that ye likewise read the epistle from Laodicea.

17.text: And say to Archippus, take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fulfill it.

18.text: The salutation by the hand of me Paul. Remember my bonds. Grace be with you. Amen.
